content.raw: Russ pointed out that this change came with a corresponding fix to the runviewer class, added later in the Spielman fork. Note to self: get that into this pull request

content.raw:
Ah, silly me, the runviewer side was already merged as pull request #22.

This is ready to merge if there are no objections.
content.html:
Ah, silly me, the runviewer side was already merged as pull request #22.

This is ready to merge if there are no objections.

content.raw: I'm not sure I like the fact it's growing another kwarg which gets stored in the connection table. Isn't this going to cause connection table mismatches with newly created shots until people recompile their connection table? Just wondering why it isn't part of the existing update mode kwarg we have?
content.html: I'm not sure I like the fact it's growing another kwarg which gets stored in the connection table. Isn't this going to cause connection table mismatches with newly created shots until people recompile their connection table? Just wondering why it isn't part of the existing update mode kwarg we have?

content.raw:
It needs to be a connection table property so that runviewer can read it in order to make the right traces. Yes, it'll cause connection table mismatches. Not sure much can be done about that - lots of updates cause connection table mismatches until a recompile, but that's no bad in the scheme of things. Maybe it should be a device property instead of a connection table property? Would that be better?

It needs to be a separate setting because If you're in synchronous mode with a tristate-driver like Monash is, you don't need to repeat the first line. But if you're in synchronous mode with a delay line  ike UMD is, you do need to repeat the first line. So they're different settings.
content.html:
It needs to be a connection table property so that runviewer can read it in order to make the right traces. Yes, it'll cause connection table mismatches. Not sure much can be done about that - lots of updates cause connection table mismatches until a recompile, but that's no bad in the scheme of things. Maybe it should be a device property instead of a connection table property? Would that be better?

It needs to be a separate setting because If you're in synchronous mode with a tristate-driver like Monash is, you don't need to repeat the first line. But if you're in synchronous mode with a delay line ike UMD is, you do need to repeat the first line. So they're different settings.

content.raw: I get that, but given the existing kwargs is a string it can hold multiple pieces of information without requiring a recompile. In this instance it probably doesn't matter \(and probably makes sense for it to stay as it is right now in the pull request\) but we should maybe think \(in the long term\) how we might ensure that changes like this don't affect people's ability to rerun "old" shots that now don't work due to a change for a feature they don't use and may not even be aware of.
content.html: I get that, but given the existing kwargs is a string it can hold multiple pieces of information without requiring a recompile. In this instance it probably doesn't matter (and probably makes sense for it to stay as it is right now in the pull request) but we should maybe think (in the long term) how we might ensure that changes like this don't affect people's ability to rerun "old" shots that now don't work due to a change for a feature they don't use and may not even be aware of.

content.raw: Yeah, agreed. We'll have to think about it.
content.html: Yeah, agreed. We'll have to think about it.
